Authors:
Nampiah Sukarno, Sri Listiyowati, Kazuhide Nara, Nurul
Rahayu
Title:
Elaphomyces tropicalis sp. nov.: A new species of
ectomycorrhizal fungus associated with dipterocarps in a lowland
tropical rainforest of Indonesia
Keywords:
Elaphomyces, hypogeous ectomycorrhiza, Shorea, taxonomy,
tropics
Abstract:
A hypogeous ectomycorrhizal fungus belonging to the genus
Elaphomyces was found in Shorea spp. vegetation at Haurbentes, West
Java, Indonesia. This fungus is proposed as a new species, namely,
Elaphomyces tropicalis, based on molecular phylogenetic analysis of ITS
rDNA sequence and morphological characters examination. Sequences of E.
tropicalis formed a distinct clade, which was sister to E. granulatus
and E. asperulus. Morphologically, E. tropicalis is distinct from E.
granulatus and E. asperulus by peridium with minute dark brown polygonal
scales on light brown background, marble pattern in the section of inner
peridium, smaller ascospores (9‒) 15‒17(‒18.5) µm diam., with
labyrinth-like ascospore ornamentation. Shorea selanica and S. leprosula
were the host of E. tropicalis, enlarging previous knowledge of
Elaphomyces host ranges
